oops, should be platform, not PDE
*** Bug 64591 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Having inspected DeleteResourceAction, I suspect the NPE is coming from the
progress reporting code itself.
Need to also find out why the nested exception is not getting logged.
Martin, do you consider this critical for testing RC1?

I know what this problem is - it was with opening dialogs on a shell that 
closes before it can open. I believe this is fixed in RC1 but I will take this 
one so that I can test this scenario.

This is another permutation of Bug 64362.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64362 ***
Reopening to investigate further

Adding Doug as he is aware of key issues.

I believe this is a general problem with the ProgressMonitorJobsDialog as it 
does not open a blocked dialog but rather expands itself when blocked.

The issue is that we can process multiple cancels (or escape keys) when it is 
blocked which means that we can potentially get a second cancelPressed which 
is blocked on the ModalContextThread. When the ModalContextThread stops 
blocking (which will occur right as it closes) the second cancel is sent to a 
button that is now nulled out after the closing of the dialog.

As a result the callback is to a null button. This was the same issue with the 
CleanDialog in M9. Doug does this sound feasible? If so we need to be sure 
about deferred key events being sent to destroyed widgets.

This is not a general issue as other dialogs are blocked out by the 
BlockedJobsDialog.
Adding John to help verify the theory.

Tod: I think we'll need to talk about this in person to make sure we 
understand each other.

> second cancel is sent to a 
> button that is now nulled out after the closing of the dialog.

The cancel button in ProgressMonitorDialog is never assigned to null, so this
doesn't seem to be a possible cause of the NPE (I would expect a widget disposed
error instead).
I believe my theory is wrong as well now. Has anyone seen this in RC1?

Seems the problem is still there in 20040603. Now it's an assertion failure, 
and the real exception seems to be swallowed again (That's the biggest 
problem!)

I have released the patch below to improve the error reporting so we cn 
hopefully get a better stack trace.

I have replicated this case in RC1. It is related to having editors opened but 
not visible on startup. Thanks for all of your help Martin.

STEPS
1) Open a lot of editors on a project so that some of them are only visible as 
chevron
2) Shutdown and restart
3) Delete the project for those editors

The behaviour is different (and arguably worse) in HEAD.  When you delete the
project the editors (the ones that weren't active at least) remain on the
chevron.  Clicking on one causes an error (unable to restore editor), and your
editor area becomes very unstable.

Here is the trace with the improved reporting:

The problem here is as follows.  When you delete the project, the visible editor
(which is in the project) gets a message to close itself.  This editor is closed
successfully, and then we tell the editor stack to make the next tab visible. 
Unfortunately, the next tab is in the deleted project, so the editor cannot be
created.  We remove the tab.  Which then causes the next tab to be made
visible...etc.  The problem is that when we setVisible on the last editor, it
cannot be created so we remove it.  We then have no editors in the presentation,
so it is disposed autmatically.  The problem is, it's disposed in the midst of
the selection call and operations are still being performed on it.  

We can check for disposal after we set visible on the part. This doesn't feel
like the right solution, but it's probably the least scary fix for the 3.0
release.  We should revisit this post 3.0.

Also note that even with this fix you will get an warning dialog telling you
that certain editors could not be created.  This warning exists in 2.1.3 as well.

Created an attachment (id=11893)
Patch against DefaultPartPresentation

Fix in HEAD.  The submitted fix differs from the patch.  In addition to a
disposal check (which handles the case when all editors are being dropped) there
is a check to ensure that if you select a bad editor when viewing a good one
that the good one is restored.  Without it, we have a blank editor area until
the good part is reseleccted.
Verified in 200406110010
Closing to keep a tidy house.  Pardon the spam.
